p.s: Starr, Seven, DeVante, and Chris get to the place, where Khalil was shoot and they see a crowd, who is protesting for Khalil.
At first, she feels very bad, because there she sees Khalil lying in the street and imagineimagines the whole situation how Khalil was shootshot.
She wasn't there since the incident, because she was a kind of traumatized of the night and to see the place, where this all happened, would make it worse.
When she getgets into the crowd, she sees her attorney Ms. Ofrah, who is also protesting, this gives Starr confidence, because at first she can't mange with the situation she is in.
When Ms. Ofrah sees Starr, she is at first kinda skeptical, because she knows how bad Starr feels and can imagine, how she feels exactrly on his place, where Khalil was shootshot.
But when she sees, that Starr wan'twants to speak up for Khalil she motivated her wit hthe fact, that her voice is her biggest weapon.
Starr is vrey emotional at this scene, because at first it makes her happy and proud, that there are so many people who protestsprotest for Khalil.
When she gets on the top of the cop car, she's kinda nervous but speeksspeaks then for Khalil up.
She's proud at herself, that she's fighting for Khalil and achieved to speekspeak out loud for Khalil.
